mbostock@gmail.com.message: Simplify check for zero-area treemap cells.

Fix a bug in histogram.frequency.

The logic was inverted. Oops! But now there are tests. Yay!
Handle padding overflow in treemap layout.

Add d3.time.scale.utc.

Also fix a bug in d3.time.hour in regards to daylight savings.
Also fix a number of tests that weren't testing the desired functionality.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/tmont/d3 into release
Merge branch 'horizon' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into release
Merge branch 'minor-opt' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into release
Merge branch 'force-rangeerror' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into release
Merge branch 'treemap' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into release

Allow multiple zoom behaviors to coexist.

Any event handlers on the window need to manage global state, as they will be
replaced when another zoom behavior is created.

Merge branch 'touch' into release

This includes nearly a complete rewrite of d3.behavior.zoom, more closely
modeled after the Polymaps po.drag, po.touch and po.wheel classes. This makes
the code simpler and also fixes a bug when releasing one of two fingers.

Merge branch 'jasondavies/force-touch' into release

I simplified the implementation to only support single-touch. I also opted not
to include touch support in the force-dynamic example (and other examples), just
because it complicates the examples too much. Touch is nice but I don't want it
to interfere with people learning the basics.

This merge also has an extra bonus fix: you can now have multiple force layouts
with dragging on the same page, and the drag behavior will do the direct the
event to the appropriate force layout.
Fix offset when dragging large nodes.
Move flare-imports.json to the data folder.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jmalonzo/d3 into jmalonzo-master

Backwards-compatibility for inlining.

There's now a new API for invoking the hierarchy layout (hierarchy.nodes) rather
than calling the layout function directly. Calling the new API enables inlining,
which is disabled by default for backwards-compatibility.

Move data files into examples directory.

This way, we don't need symlinks (which don't work on Windows). This commit also
simplifies the structure of the flare.json file, so that we don't need to tricky
conversion of the JSON map—it can be read directly by the hierarchy layout.
Remove `inline` property, making it the default.

Adopt inline(true) for all hierarchy examples.

The ones with transitions were a bit trickier, because they depended on the
layout creating new copy of the nodes when the layout runs.

Add `inline` property to hierarchy layout.

This allows you to disable the default behavior which wraps the input data. I am
investigating whether we can disable automatic wrapping, which causes confusion
between "data" and "nodes".
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/vtstarin/d3 into vtstarin-master

jason@jasondavies.com.message:
Fix handling of zero-sized nodes.

Previously, negative or zero sizes were short-circuiting the worst()
function by always returning Infinity, instead of being ignored for the
score computation.

Fixes #233.
Add SVG-based treemap example.
Fix typo and add padding tests.
Rename nodeRect to pad, and add missing semicolon.

Don't add padding to root node.

Also, optimise internal scale() function slightly.
Add some tests for 0, negative or NaN values.
Be smart about padding. Thanks, @mbostock. :)
Improvements to padding, thanks to @mbostock.

Add support for padding to treemap layout.

The new "padding" property is an array of [top, right, bottom, left], or a
function that returns such an array for a given node.
Fix typo.
Minor optimisation.

Prevent RangeError in Safari.

For very large force layouts, Safari was throwing "RangeError: Maximum call
stack size exceeded".  I think this is due to Safari having a smaller call stack
than Chrome and FireFox.  In any case, this fix replaces forEach with a while
loop, which should be faster in all browsers as well as reducing the call stack
size needed and thus fixing the Safari issue.

Better protection against NaN and negative values.

Also, a more symmetric prevention of NaN in the scoring function from Mike:
"rmax is 0 if and only if s is 0, so it is equivalent".

Better fix for zero-area nodes.

Instead of filtering them out, we fix the root of the issue instead, which is
that the scoring function "worst" was returning NaN due to calculating 0/0,
instead of Infinity.
Ignore negative areas in treemap layout.
Ignore zero-area nodes in treemap layout.

Remove force.gravityCenter.

Simpler to perform gravity calculations in a custom tick handler.

Add per-node gravity: force.gravityCenter.

This allows the Dorling/Demers cartograms to be slightly closer to the real
geography.

Also, fix the Dorling collision detection as self-collisions were previously
being detected.  Thanks, Mike!

Lastly, I've removed the variable per-link distance as this is no longer needed.
Add strokes to Dorling and Demers cartograms.

Add Demers cartogram example.

Like a Dorling cartogram, but with squares instead of circles.
Nicer colors for Dorling cartogram.
Use collision detection for Dorling cartogram.

Initial version of Dorling cartogram example.

This version uses variable-length links, but I think collision detection
performed after initial positioning at state centroids would look better.

Add missing force.linkStrength property.

Also update examples to use force.linkDistance instead of force.distance.

Add variable link strength (alpha) to force layout.

Also, rename force.distance to force.linkDistance, but keep force.distance as an
alias for backwards-compatibility.

Fixes #211.

Replace "new Array" with "[]".

See <http://jsperf.com/new-array-vs-literal/8>.

Add variable link distance to force layout.

See: #211.
Remove dangling d3.stats.js reference.
Move data files and delete symlinks.

Merge branch 'master' into kde

Conflicts:
	Makefile
	d3.js
	d3.min.js
	src/core/sum.js
Remove old stats test references from Makefile.
Move d3.stats to external lib, science.stats.js!

tommy.mont@gmail.com.message: verify that the node to remove after a transition actually has a parent node

justin@labratrevenge.com.message: allow access of original data when computing arcs in pie layout

ignacioola@gmail.com.message: zoom bug: function and var with same name

Update cartogram/choropleth symlink to point to examples/data.
